section.p: AndStatus is an Open Source low traffic social networking client with tree-like threaded conversations. It supports multiple protocols, including GNU social, Twitter and Pump.io. AndStatus combines your accounts from all networks into one Timeline and allows you reading and posting even while you are offline.
Link to this guide is available in the Action bar->Help.
Change Log on the next page will allow you to see descriptions and links to discussions of all features of AndStatus.
Tap "Get Started" button below: screen to add new account will be opened.
First you will be prompted to select a Social network of an account from a list. Twitter, Pump.io and several "GNU social"-type systems (Quitter, LoadAverage and Vinilox) are preconfigured.

In a case your ("GNU social"-type) system is not listed, tap "Discover open instances" menu item to choose a system from a live online list, maintained by GNU social community; or "Add new system" manually before adding new account.
For Twitter you are allowed to press "Add this account" immediately. For other systems you will be prompted to type your Username and Password before you will be allowed to "Add this account".

After successful creation of an account, please tap "left arrow" on an "Action bar" or "Back" button on your device. This time a Home Timeline will be opened, and messages for this account will start downloading from the Internet.
Congratulations! Please read below about what you can do further.
And don't forget to add AndStatus's widget to a Home screen of Your device: the widget will inform you about new messages and may be used to launch AndStatus.
The first view of AndStatus (after at least one account has been added) contains a Home Timeline.
In order to perform an action on a message in the list you should hold down on it to get its "Context menu".
You may click a message to get more details on it and to see a conversation tree to which the message belongs.
Open a "Navigation Drawer" on a left and tap current Timeline type item ("Home") to switch to the other views.
In order to update your status, tap the "Post" button ("Tweet" for Twitter), type in a text into the text area at the bottom of the screen and tap Send.
In order to reply, hold down a message and select Reply from a Context menu, type in your reply at the bottom.
To abort a reply, simply tap the "Hide" button to hide the text area.
Open a Navigation Drawer on a left, tap current Timeline type item (Home) and select Direct Messages from the list.
In order to delete your message (public or private), hold down on it and select Remove message.

New messages are fetched to timelines in a background if you have turned on Automatic sync in Android "Account and Sync" settings for this AndStatus Account. In any case you may always get updates from the Internet manually using "Reload" command on an Action bar.
Tap current Timeline type item in a Navigation Drawer and then select Mentions .
Mentions will list every message that mentions your @username (or even mentions of all your AndStatus accounts for a "combined" timeline).
Local search searches among messages already loaded from the Internet. Hence it is available even offline.
1. In order to find any word or phrase in a text of messages, select Search on an Action bar or click a dedicated Search button on your device.
If you wish to show messages from a specific user, please search for "username".
To see mentions of a specific User, search for "@username".

2. To search quickly for messages by a user (an Author or a Sender of a selected message), select "Messages by UserName" from the context menu of the message. This is actually sort of a Global Search (see below).
Global search function sends a search request directly to Social networks' servers. This is why live Internet connection to the networks is required.

First, you are presented with the results of the Local search. In parallel, AndStatus downloads results from a Social network of the selected Account (or from all Social networks, if a Timeline is "combined"). Search results are being updated upon receiving responses from the servers. In a case of connection error (i.e. no response from a server of a Social network) you will see results of a Local Search only.
Please note that pump.io system doesn't support Global search yet.
1. Global search by a word or a phrase is initiated using its "Global search" item on an "Action bar".
2. Another way to search globally for messages by an Author or a Sender of the selected message is to select "Messages by UserName" from a Context menu of this message.
